item.title: LANs and WANs

item.title: Network - Components
item.description: Table of Contents Overview End Devices Examples Intermediary Network Devices Examples Functions Network Media Other Terminologies Topology Diagrams Overview The path that a message takes from source to destination can be as simple as a single cable connecting one computer to another, or as complex as a collection of networks that literally spans the globe. This network infrastructure provides the stable and reliable channel over which these communications occur.

item.title: Network - Provide Resources
item.description: Table of Contents Network of Many Sizes Small Home Networks Small Office/Home Office (SOHO) Networks Medium to Large Networks World Wide Networks Clients and Servers Host Roles Servers Clients Examples Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Networking Network of Many Sizes Networks come in all sizes, ranging from simple networks consisting of two computers to complex ones connecting millions of devices. Small Home Networks connect a few computers to one another and to the internet.
